intro: Pedicularis filicula var. filicula, commonly known as the fern-leaved monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble a monkey's face. The plant is hemiparasitic, deriving some of its nutrients from the roots of neighboring plants. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinct appearance.
